ibis.deploy
Class Application

java.lang.Object
  ibis.deploy.Application

public class Application
extends java.lang.Object

Ibis-based Java Application Description. Applications are usually part of (and created by) an ApplicationSet.

Author:
Niels Drost

Application

public Application(java.lang.String name)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new application with a given name and parent ApplicationSet object.

Parameters:
name - the name of the application
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if name is null or contains periods and/or spaces

getLibs

public java.io.File[] getLibs()
Returns list of library (jar) files required to run this application. May include directories and non-jar files.

Returns:
list of library (jar) files.

setLibs

public void setLibs(java.io.File... libs)
Sets list of library (jar) files required to run this application. May include directories and non-jar files.

Parameters:
libs - new list of library files and directories.

addLib

public void addLib(java.io.File lib)
Adds file or directory to list of library (jar) files required to run this application.

Parameters:

getInputFiles

public java.io.File[] getInputFiles()
Returns application input files.

Returns:
list of input files

setInputFiles

public void setInputFiles(java.io.File... inputFiles)
Sets application input files, overwriting any previous setting. There is no need to add libraries to this list, as they are automatically pre-staged.

Parameters:
inputFiles - new list of input files

addInputFile

public void addInputFile(java.io.File inputFile)
Add a single input file to the list of input files. Automatically creates list, if needed.

Parameters:
inputFile - new input file

getOutputFiles

public java.io.File[] getOutputFiles()
Returns list of output files. Files are copied from the "root" directory of the application, to the local file specified.

Returns:
list of output files.

setOutputFiles

public void setOutputFiles(java.io.File... outputFiles)
Sets list of output files. Files are copied from the "root" directory of the application, to the local file specified.

Parameters:
outputFiles - new list of output files.

addOutputFile

public void addOutputFile(java.io.File outputFile)
Add file to list of output files. File with name "outputFile.getName()" is copied from the root of the application sandbox to the file specified.

Parameters:
outputFile - new output file.

getSystemProperties

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSystemProperties()
Returns (copy of) map of all system properties.

Returns:
all system properties, or null if unset.

setSystemProperties

public void setSystemProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> systemProperties)
Sets map of all system properties.

Parameters:
systemProperties - new system properties, or null to unset.

                              java.lang.String value)
Sets a single system property. Map will be created if needed.

Parameters:
name - name of new property
value - value of new property.

getMemorySize

public int getMemorySize()
Returns the amount of memory used for the application, in Megabytes. Defaults to 0 for "unset"

Returns:
the amount of memory used for the application, in Megabytes.

setMemorySize

public void setMemorySize(int memorySize)
Sets the amount of memory used by the application, in Megabytes.

Parameters:
memorySize - the new amount of memory for this application, in Megabytes.

checkSettings

public void checkSettings(java.lang.String jobName)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Checks if this application is suitable for deploying. If not, throws an exception.

Parameters:
jobName - name of job
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if this application is incomplete or incorrect.
